meanings.definition: A series of steps or seats in a theater or stadium.
meanings.sent1: The theater was packed, every gradine filled with excited spectators.
meanings.sent2: She climbed up the gradine to reach her seat at the top of the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The gradine seemed to whisper secrets to those who sat upon it.
meanings.sent4: As the lights dimmed, the gradine transformed into a magical staircase to another world.
meanings.sent5: The gradine creaked under the weight of the crowd, adding to the suspense of the performance.

meanings.sent1: He placed the vase carefully on the gradine, making sure it wouldn't fall.
meanings.sent2: The cat found a cozy spot on the gradine by the window to bask in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The gradine in the kitchen was perfect for displaying her collection of teacups.
meanings.sent4: The gradine of books in the library seemed to reach up to the sky, full of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: She imagined herself as a tiny ant climbing the steep gradine of the bookshelf, searching for adventure.
